023import static java.lang.String.format;
024import static java.lang.Thread.currentThread;
025import static java.util.stream.Collectors.toMap;
026import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
027import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;

032import java.util.ArrayList;

034import java.util.Collection;

054/**
055 *  Several utility functions to be used with JavaComposer.
056 *
057 *  @author Square,Inc.
058 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
059 *  @version $Id: Util.java 1066 2023-09-28 19:51:53Z tquadrat $
060 *  @since 0.0.5
061 *
062 *  @UMLGraph.link
063 */
064@SuppressWarnings( "NewClassNamingConvention" )
065@UtilityClass
066@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Util.java 1066 2023-09-28 19:51:53Z tquadrat $" )
067public final class Util
068{
069        /*-----------*\
070    ====** Constants **========================================================
071        \*-----------*/
072    /**
073     *  The placeholder for {@code null} references.
074     */
075    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
076    public static final Object NULL_REFERENCE = new Object();
077
078    /**
079     *  The return value of
080     *  {@link #createDebugOutput(boolean)}
081     *  when no debug output is desired.
082     */
083    @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalUsedAsFieldOrParameterType" )
084    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
085    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT = Optional.empty();
086
087        /*--------------*\
088    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
089        \*--------------*/
090    /**
091     *  No instance allowed for this class.
092     */
093    private Util() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Util.class ); }
094
095        /*---------*\
096    ====** Methods **==========================================================
097        \*---------*/
098    /**
099     *  Translates the given character into a String; when that character is a
100     *  special character, it will be escaped properly so that it can be used
101     *  in a Java String literal.
102     *
103     *  @param  c   The input character.
104     *  @return The target String.
105     *
106     *  @see <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se10/html/jls-3.html#jls-3.10.6">The Java Language Specification: 3.10.6. Escape Sequences for Character and String Literals </a>
107     */
108    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
109    public static final String characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes( final char c )
110    {
111        final var retValue = switch( c )
112        {
113            case '\b' -> "\\b"; // u0008: backspace (BS)
114            case '\t' -> "\\t"; // u0009: horizontal tab (HT)
115            case '\n' -> "\\n"; // u000a: linefeed (LF)
116            case '\f' -> "\\f"; // u000c: form feed (FF)
117            case '\r' -> "\\r"; // u000d: carriage return (CR)
118            case '"' -> Character.toString( c ); // u0022: double quote (")
119            case '\'' -> "\\'"; // u0027: single quote (')
120            case '\\' -> "\\\\"; // u005c: backslash (\)
121            default -> isISOControl( c ) ? format( "\\u%04x", (int) c ) : Character.toString( c );
122        };
123
124        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
125        return retValue;
126    }   //  characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes()
127
128    /**
129     *  Checks the given {@code condition} and throws a
130     *  {@link ValidationException}
131     *  if it is {@code false}.
132     *
133     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
134     *  @param  format  The message format for the exception message.
135     *  @param  args    The arguments for the exception message.
136     *  @throws ValidationException The condition was not met.
137     *
138     *  @deprecated Use
139     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#checkState(boolean, Supplier)},
140     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Function, Predicate)},
141     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Supplier, Predicate)},
142     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, String, Predicate)},
143     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Predicate)},
144     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
145     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)},
146     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
147     *      or
148     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)}
149     *      instead.
150     */
151    @SuppressWarnings( "DeprecatedIsStillUsed" )
152    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
153    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
154    public static final void checkArgument( final boolean condition, final String format, final Object... args ) throws ValidationException
155    {
156        if( !condition ) throw new ValidationException( format( format, args ) );
157    }   //  checkArgument()
158
159    /**
160     *  Checks the given {@code condition} and throws a
161     *  {@link IllegalStateException}
162     *  if it is {@code false}.
163     *
164     *  @param  condition   The condition to check.
165     *  @param  format  The message format for the exception message.
166     *  @param  args    The arguments for the exception message.
167     *  @throws IllegalStateException The condition was not met.
168     *
169     *  @deprecated Use
170     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#checkState(boolean, Supplier)},
171     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Function, Predicate)},
172     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Supplier, Predicate)},
173     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, String, Predicate)},
174     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#require(Object, Predicate)},
175     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
176     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)},
177     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate)}
178     *      or
179     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects#requireValidNonNullArgument(Object, String, Predicate, java.util.function.UnaryOperator)}
180     *      instead.
181     */
182    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
183    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
184    public static final void checkState( final boolean condition, final String format, final Object... args )
185    {
186        if( !condition ) throw new IllegalStateException( format( format, args ) );
187    }   //  checkState()
188
189    /**
190     *  Creates the debug output.
191     *
192     *  @param  addDebugOutput  {@code true} if some debug output should be
193     *      added to the generated code, {@code false} otherwise.
194     *  @param  fromBuilder {@code true} if the call was made from a builder,
195     *      {@code false} otherwise.
196     *  @return An instance of
197     *      {@link Optional}
198     *      that holds the debug output; empty if the parameter
199     *      {@code addDebugOutput} is {@code false}.
200     *
201     *  @see #NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT
202     *
203     *  @deprecated Replaced by
204     *      {@link #createDebugOutput(boolean)}
205     *      because of a reworked debug output pattern.
206     */
207    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
208    @SuppressWarnings( "BooleanParameter" )
209    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
210    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> createDebugOutput( final boolean addDebugOutput, final boolean fromBuilder )
211    {
212        //---* Get the caller's caller *---------------------------------------
213        final var depth = fromBuilder ? 4 : 3;
214        final var retValue = addDebugOutput ? Optional.of( new DebugOutput( JavaUtils.findCaller( depth ) ) ) : NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT;
215
216        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
217        return retValue;
218    }   //  createDebugOutput()
219
220    /**
221     *  Creates the debug output.
222     *
223     *  @param  addDebugOutput  {@code true} if some debug output should be
224     *      added to the generated code, {@code false} otherwise.
225     *  @return An instance of
226     *      {@link Optional}
227     *      that holds the debug output; empty if the parameter
228     *      {@code addDebugOutput} is {@code false}.
229     *
230     *  @see #NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT
231     */
232    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
233    public static final Optional<DebugOutput> createDebugOutput( final boolean addDebugOutput )
234    {
235        //---* Get the caller's caller *---------------------------------------
236        final var retValue = addDebugOutput ? Optional.of( new DebugOutput( findCaller() ) ) : NO_DEBUG_OUTPUT;
237
238        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
239        return retValue;
240    }   //  createDebugOutput()
241
242    /**
243     *  <p>{@summary This method will find the method that makes the call into
244     *  the Java Composer API and returns the appropriate stack trace
245     *  element.}</p>
246     *  <p>The respective method is determined by the package name of the
247     *  containing class: it does <i>not</i> start with
248     *  {@code org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer}.</p>
249     *
250     *  @return An instance of
251     *      {@link Optional}
252     *      that holds the stack trace element for the caller; will be empty if
253     *      the call was internal.
254     */
255    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.2.0" )
256    private static final Optional<StackTraceElement> findCaller()
257    {
258        //---* Retrieve the stack *--------------------------------------------
259        final var stackTraceElements = currentThread().getStackTrace();
260        final var len = stackTraceElements.length;
261
262        //---* Search the stack *----------------------------------------------
263        Optional<StackTraceElement> retValue = Optional.empty();
264        FindLoop: for( var i = 1; i < len; ++i )
265        {
266            final var className = stackTraceElements [i].getClassName();
267            if( !className.startsWith( "org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer" ) )
268            {
269                retValue = Optional.of( stackTraceElements [i] );
270                break FindLoop;
271            }
272        }   //  FindLoop:
273
274        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
275        return retValue;
276    }   //  findCaller()
277
278    /**
279     *  Creates an immutable list from the given collection.
280     *
281     *  @param  <T> The type of the list elements.
282     *  @param  collection  The collection.
283     *  @return The immutable list.
284     *
285     *  @deprecated Use
286     *      {@link List#copyOf(Collection)}
287     *      instead.
288     */
289    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
290    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
291    public static final <T> List<T> immutableList( final Collection<T> collection )
292    {
293        final var retValue = List.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( collection, "collection" ) );
294
295        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
296        return retValue;
297    }   //  immutableList()
298
299    /**
300     *  Creates an immutable map from the given map.
301     *
302     *  @param  <K> The type of the map's keys.
303     *  @param  <V> The type of the map's values.
304     *  @param  map The map.
305     *  @return The immutable copy of the input map.
306     *
307     *  @deprecated Use
308     *      {@link Map#copyOf(Map)}
309     *      instead.
310     */
311    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
312    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
313    public static final <K,V> Map<K,V> immutableMap( final Map<K,V> map )
314    {
315        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( map, "map" ) );
316
317        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
318        return retValue;
319    }   //  immutableMap()
320
321    /**
322     *  Creates an immutable multimap from the given multimap.
323     *
324     *  @param  <K> The type of the map's keys.
325     *  @param  <V> The type of the map's values.
326     *  @param  multiMap    The multimap.
327     *  @return The immutable copy of the input multimap.
328     *
329     *  @deprecated No replacement!
330     */
331    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
332    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
333    public static final <K,V> Map<K,List<V>> immutableMultimap( final Map<? extends K, ? extends List<V>> multiMap )
334    {
335        final BinaryOperator<List<V>> merger = (v1,v2) ->
336        {
337            final Collection<V> collection = new ArrayList<>( v1.size() + v2.size() );
338            collection.addAll( v1 );
339            collection.addAll( v2 );
340            return List.copyOf( collection );
341        };
342
343        final Map<K,List<V>> buffer = requireNonNullArgument( multiMap, "multiMap" ).entrySet().stream()
344            .filter( e -> nonNull( e.getValue() ) && !e.getValue().isEmpty() )
345            .collect( toMap( Entry::getKey, e -> List.copyOf( e.getValue() ), merger, LinkedHashMap::new  ) );
346        final var retValue = Map.copyOf( buffer );
347
348        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
349        return retValue;
350    }   //  immutableMultimap()
351
352    /**
353     *  Creates an immutable set from the given collection.
354     *
355     *  @param  <T> The type of the set elements.
356     *  @param  collection  The collection.
357     *  @return The immutable set.
358     *
359     *  @deprecated Use
360     *      {@link Set#copyOf(Collection)}
361     *      instead.
362     */
363    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
364    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
365    public static final <T> Set<T> immutableSet( final Collection<T> collection )
366    {
367        final var retValue = Set.copyOf( requireNonNullArgument( collection, "collection" ) );
368
369        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
370        return retValue;
371    }   //  immutableSet()
372
373    /**
374     *  Returns the Java String literal representing {@code value}, including
375     *  escaping double quotes.
376     *
377     *  @param  value   The input String.
378     *  @param  indent  The indentation String that has to be added in case of
379     *      a line break.
380     *  @return The Java literal.
381     */
382    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
383    public static String stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes( final String value, final String indent )
384    {
385        final var retValue = new StringBuilder( value.length() + 2 );
386        retValue.append( '"' );
387        ScanLoop: for( var i = 0; i < value.length(); ++i )
388        {
389            final var currentChar = value.charAt( i );
390
391            //---* The trivial case: single quote must not be escaped *--------
392            if( currentChar == '\'' )
393            {
394                retValue.append( "'" );
395                continue ScanLoop;
396            }
397
398            //---* Another trivial case: double quotes must be escaped *-------
399            if( currentChar == '"' )
400            {
401                retValue.append( '\\' ).append( '"' );
402                continue ScanLoop;
403            }
404
405            /*
406             * The default case: just let characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes()
407             * do its work.
408             */
409            retValue.append( characterLiteralWithoutSingleQuotes( currentChar ) );
410
411            //---* Do we need to append indent after linefeed? *---------------
412            if( currentChar == '\n' && i + 1 < value.length() )
413            {
414                /*
415                 * Originally, the indentation string was appended twice.
416                 */
417                retValue.append( "\"\n" ).append( indent ).append( "+ \"" );
418            }
419        }   //  ScanLoop:
420        retValue.append( '"' );
421
422        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
423        return retValue.toString();
424    }   //  stringLiteralWithDoubleQuotes()
425
426    /**
427     *  Checks whether the given
428     *  {@link Set}
429     *  of
430     *  {@link Modifier}
431     *  instances does contain one and only one of the {@code Modifier}
432     *  instances given with the second argument, {@code mutuallyExclusive}.
433     *
434     *  @param  modifiers   The set to check.
435     *  @param  mutuallyExclusive   A list of values from which one and only
436     *      one must be in the {@code modifiers} set.
437     *  @throws ValidationException None or more than one {@code Modifier}
438     *      instance was found.
439     */
440    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
441    public static final void requireExactlyOneOf( final Set<Modifier> modifiers, final Modifier... mutuallyExclusive ) throws ValidationException
442    {
443        requireNonNullArgument( modifiers, "modifiers" );
444        final var count = (int) Arrays.stream( requireNonNullArgument( mutuallyExclusive, "mutuallyExclusive" ) )
445            .filter( modifiers::contains )
446            .count();
447        checkArgument( count == 1, "modifiers %s must contain one of %s", modifiers, Arrays.toString( mutuallyExclusive ) );
448    }   //  requireExactlyOneOf()
449
450    /**
451     *  Creates a new set with the combined contents of the given sets.
452     *
453     *  @param  <T> The type of the set elements.
454     *  @param  firstSet    The first set.
455     *  @param  secondSet   The second set.
456     *  @return The combined set.
457     */
458    @SuppressWarnings( "TypeMayBeWeakened" )
459    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
460    public static final <T> Set<T> union( final Set<? extends T> firstSet, final Set<? extends T> secondSet )
461    {
462        final Set<T> retValue = new LinkedHashSet<>( firstSet );
463        retValue.addAll( secondSet );
464
465        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
466        return retValue;
467    }   //  union()
468}
469//  class Util
